title.en: A Prayer to the Vajradhara Gurus, the Gentle Protectors

text.en: Padmasambhava, who attained the deathless wisdom kāya,
Appearing once again here and now to illuminate the great secret
text.en-trans: dengdir lar yangsang chen dorjé tek

text.en: Vajra vehicle and help it to flourish throughout the whole of space and time,
Supreme glorious guru, endowed with the five wisdoms,
Personification of the vajra body, speech and mind,
text.en-trans: daknyi chen gyi palden lama chok

text.en: Remain for a hundred aeons, and for the sake of us all,
text.en-trans: kal gyar zhuk ching dak sok dro nam la

text.en: Turn uninterruptedly the Dharma Wheel of the indestructible nāda,
text.en-trans: zhommé na dé chökhor gyün mi ché

text.en: Thereby planting the seeds of the four kāyas, I pray.
text.en-trans: pab né ku zhi sabön tab dzé sol

text.en: Utterly pacify any outer and inner obstacles, and
text.en-trans: zhenyang chi nang bar chö rabzhi zhing

text.en: Make everything auspicious, so that positive, harmonious circumstances
text.en-trans: tünkyen lektsok yar gyi chuter tar

text.en: Never wane but continually increase just like a lake in summer.
For me and all sentient beings, as infinite as space,
text.en-trans: dak dang khanyam semchen malü kün

text.en: From now until we attain awakening,
text.en-trans: deng né zung té changchub matob bar

text.en: Guide us without ever parting and grant us blessings and attainments.
